Belgium:
Pieter and François Hemony cast the first tuned carillon
Gravelines taken by the French after a two-month siege
Brazil: Johan Mauritius resigns as Governor of Brazil.
Chile: Captain Juan de Acevedo departs to investigate about the Dutch presence in Valdivia, entering the site of the ruins and finding they have left.
China: The Chongzhen Emperor hanged himself from the Zuihuai as the army of Li Zicheng's Shun dynasty breached the walls of the Ming capital Beijing. Battle of Shanhai Pass: A Shun army was dealt a heavy defeat by the Qing and the former Ming general Wu Sangui at Shanhai Pass. Li Zicheng fled Beijing.
India:
Guru Har Rai becomes seventh guru of Sikhs
Shivaji takes oath of Independence at Raireshwar.
